title: PM Rajapaksa meets ruling party MPs at Temple Trees
body_lines: COLOMBO (News 1st); A meeting was held between Prime Minister Mahinda Rajapaksa and the Government MPs on Wednesday (7) night at the Temple Trees.

Speaking to News 1st, following the meeting, MP Major Pradeep Undugoda said discussions were held on the appointment of a new Cabinet of Ministers as it was responsibility of the Government to resolve the issues faced by the people, at this crucial juncture.

However, also speaking to reporters after the meeting, MP Wasantha Yapa Bandara said the discussions focused on the future proceedings, adding that NO disscussions were held on the appointment of a new cabinet of ministers.
He said the resignation of the President will NOT resolve the prevailing crisis situation.
MP Wasantha Yapa Bandara noted that the discussions focused on resolving to the supply chain issues to ensure that people’s needs are met.
President must go for us to consider any proposal – Anura Kumara
